title: Edict of Flavius Felix Eumathus regarding the Thermae Achillianae
support:
A very wide text laid out across multiple marble slabs of
                                            differing widths, of which 8 pieces are preserved (originally 6, but two
                                            have become further fragmented over time). The slabs were most likely
                                            displayed on the facade of the building to which they relate.

layout.p:
Greek text over four lines. The fourth line is shorter than the
                                        other three and ends with a vacat. The letters are broadly regular and neatly
                                        cut, but the sizing and spacing varies considerably across the four lines.

handNote.lettering:
Letters are wide and omicron, phi, sigma, epsilon and theta are, on
                                    occasion formed by overlarge circles. Epsilon, sigma and omega are lunate. Xsi is
                                    formed in a distinctive, ornate fashion. Interpuncts are used occasionally, and
                                    formed of an 's' shape, sometimes forward, sometimes backward facing. Numerals are
                                    marked with a supraline.

date._: 434 CE (reporting an edict from the consuls of 433)

provenanceFound._: Found c.1702 in the remains of the baths situated under the west end of the Duomo of Catania
